metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28735 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The GRUB2's shim_lock verifier allows non-kernel files to be loaded on shim-powered secure boot systems. Allowing such files to be loaded may lead to unverified code and modules to be loaded in GRUB2 breaking the secure boot trust-chain.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.187.3~18.04.1
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.187.3~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.06-2ubuntu14.1
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu14.1
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.06-2ubuntu14.1
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu14.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: grub2 package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
grub2-signed package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.187.3~18.04.1').
grub2-unsigned package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.06-2ubuntu14.1').
